item.title: Mark of Zorro
item.description: Mark of Zorro is a 1975 Italian adventure comedy film directed by Franco Lo Cascio.

item.title: El Macho
item.description: El Macho is a 1977 Italian-Argentine Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Marcello Andrei.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: Two Sons of Ringo is a 1966 Italian western-parody film. It was the last film directed by Giorgio Simonelli who, for health reasons, left the production just before the end of filming and was replaced by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Holy God, Here Comes the Passatore!
item.description: Fuori uno sotto un altro... arriva il passatore is a 1973 Italian adventure-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Massacre Time
item.description: Massacre Time is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film starring Franco Nero and George Hilton.

item.title: Professionisti per un massacro
item.description: Red Blood, Yellow Gold, is a 1967 Italian-Spanish spaghetti western film directed by Nando Cicero.

item.title: Poker with Pistols
item.description: Poker with Pistols is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari.

item.title: Il momento di uccidere
item.description: The Moment To Kill is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western film.

item.title: I Am Sartana, Trade Your Guns for a Coffin
item.description: Sartana's Here… Trade Your Pistol for a Coffin is a 1970 spaghetti western that is the third of the Sartana film series with George Hilton taking over the lead role from Gianni Garko. The film was shot in Italy and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Any Gun Can Play
item.description: Any Gun Can Play is a 1967 spaghetti western starring Gilbert Roland, Edd Byrnes and George Hilton. The film is directed by Enzo G. Castellari. The film is about a group of cowboys searching for gold, double-leading to double crosses as they continually change allegiances and get the upper hand only to be thwarted by fellow outlaws, mysterious insurance investigators and each other.
